name: Courtyard Providence Warwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with the ease of check in and the general quality of this hotel. However I cannot rate it a 5 because it did not have a safe deposit box in the room. I would expect this in a hotel of this quality. Also, the full length mirror had no light over it and so was not very useful. I would not have noticed this minor issue, but I was going to a formal party and really did need to use the mirror. It is a shame that there is an abandoned run down restaurant in front that deters from the overall looks of the area. I would certainly stay here again due to the fine service from the staff.
reviews.title: Needs a couple of minor additions to the room to make it a 5

reviews.text: Very nice CY in so-so surroundings, but very convenient to PVD. Turn in your rental and the CY shuttle will pick you up at the rental car complex. Rachel at the front desk was very, very helpful with dining advice and general help. Nice new lobby in the new CY cafe bistro design. Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location for Providence Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple weeks prior to our stay, I booked our room over the phone with Rachel, who could not have been nicer or more helpful. Upon check-in, we were warmly greeted. Later that day, due to an apparent hotel system glitch, our initial check-in was not recognized and our room was momentarily given to someone else. The problem was efficiently and quickly resolved by the staff (before the other family even had a chance to enter our room)...and the next morning I received a handwritten note of apology along with a gift bag from the hotel manager. When staying at a reasonably priced hotel such as this one, I regard room/overall cleanliness as the A #1 priority....and Courtyard Providence Warwick did not disappoint in this area. I would not hesitate for a moment to return here!
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service Here!

reviews.text: As a lifetime platinum member with Marriott I expect great service and clean facilities. This Courtyard in Warwick has both of them. They have redone their hotel in the last year or so and I must say it is superb. Great eating facility, outdoor lounging, and pool facility. Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Marriott.

reviews.text: The hotel staff were helpful and personable. We arrived before check in time after driving 14 hours. They immediately accomodated us and got us into our rooms.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Arrived on Saturday afternoon. Check-in was smooth and efficient and we were upgraded to a suite - they said because we're Marriott Rewards members.
reviews.title: Very nice Courtyard - showing a little wear

reviews.text: The suite was the real thing. Separate living room, two TV's, two thermostats, wet bar with fridge and microwave. There was no minibar, which was fine with us. The suite was very spacious and included a balcony with a table and a couple of chairs. WIFI was free, fast and dependable.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Providence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is right off I95. Easy off and on and 10 minutes to downtown Providence.
reviews.title: Great location near Providence Airport

reviews.text: Three minor complaints: the curtains at the door to the balcony were jammed making them difficult to open or close. The latch on the bathroom door was stuck in the recessed position so the door could not be latched or locked. Most annoying, the drain in the shower was extremely slow, although water pressure was fine.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service, good rooms, and very cool Bistro

reviews.text: We recently stayed in the Courtyard Providence Warwick for 3 nights while visiting friends in the area. We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable with a friendly and helpful staff. The pool and hot tub area was clean and in good shape and the fitness equipment was up-to-date in an inviting atmosphere. This is a place I would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Great place for a weekend get away!

reviews.text: Overnight stay. The hotel felt isolated in the middle of a industrial zone near the highway. The lobby is renovated recently with the typical Courtyard look and feel. The room is cozy enough with a microwave added, a pleasant surprise but no safe. The heater knocking sound was very loud; enough to wake me up at 4:30am when it kicked in at the early morning hour.Not happy.
reviews.title: Typical Courtyard Marriott

reviews.text: I recently needed to make reservations for a group high school event that was being held in Providence, I always stay at Marriotts but the ones in the city charged for parking and would not include any group deal or breakfast. Both people in the sales department were very helpful and efficient. The group rate was $99 and included breakfast at the new bistro. The food is adequate to get you going in the morning and quick and convenient. Courtyards are all the same set up so you know what you are getting and they are very appropriate for groups. The lobby allows for getting together easily and the touch screen is handy. here are computers available for free but most everyone has internet on their cell phones anyway! There is an excercise room, pool and hot tub. What we enjoyed most was the helpful and friendly staff. They were there for anything we asked! I plan on staying there again next year for the same event. As other posts have mentioned, the one drawback is that there are no restaurants nearby. There are 2 or 3 hotels at that exit off 95 and it seems as though as family type restaurant should do very well.
reviews.title: Excellent for large groups

reviews.text: The hotel is nice - there are issues however. Typical Cyard
reviews.title: Nice hotel - but issues - eat elsewhere

reviews.text: I came across 4 or 5 ants in the gym and one came back to my room. The gym has nice equipment but no bike.
reviews.title: Ok, for Warwick...

reviews.text: Most disappointing were three things:
reviews.title: I love Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During my 3 week road trip in New England I stayed in lots of different motels, hotels and inns and my guide book sent me to Warwick for affordable motel options. Having never stayed at a Courtyard before I decided to try it and just walking in to the lobby after a long day of travel made my day. It looks bright, inviting and comfortable. Front desk staff was very friendly and amicable. Room was very nice with a king size bed, very comfortable duvet and pillows, a small couch, a small balcony. Also the lay out of the room is a bit different from other motels I stayed at with a bed facing the balcony and the fridge and micro hidden behind a little wall around the corner which keeps the noise from the fridge away. The room was very clean and modern and I was sad to have to leave after just 1 night. Only down side is the industrial location. Not a lot to do.
reviews.title: A real treat

reviews.text: When you have been on 95 too long and can pull off for less than 2 minutes and arrive a stop like this it is fantastic. Very Clean, all expected amenties of a modern updated courtyard. Great jacuzzi and nice pool.
reviews.title: Great Stop

reviews.text: Well worth it
reviews.title: What a great overall experience!!

reviews.text: I brought my cheerleading teams (w/their families) here to compete at a "US Finals" competition, so this was a big weekend for these girls! Sue Gallogly was such a pleasure to work with from start to finish! She helped us work out the best deals for our group, helped us with rooming assignments (adjoining rooms, etc), even helped us in planning the weekends events, suggestions on where to have our pizza party and even where to order the pizza from! (along with a folder waiting in my room with menus and maps for all of the above). The staff was so pleasant, helpful and accommodating (especially with our group of 5-18yr old girls!). The lobby was extremely spacious and worked well for our pizza party with all the girls, coaches and families. Rooms were pleasant and the Coaches' adjoining rooms (with the extra room and balcony adjoining them) were fantastic for the coaches and girls to meet throughout the weekend as well. Wish the weather had been a bit more pleasant, as the fire-pit outside was offered for our use, but was unable to be lit due to the wet conditions, but the staff did attempt it nonetheless. We did leave with a Championship team and look forward to staying here if our girls win a bid to compete in Providence again next year! Thanks so much for helping to make our weekend such a memorable one!
reviews.title: 5 miles saves 100$

reviews.text: Yes it's not downtown but you can be there in 5 min. This is a clean, easy in and out place to stay. Not far off the interstate but somewhat hidden. Rooms are clean. Libby has quick food and cocktails. Not bad.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay, good location

description: The Courtyard by Marriott Providence Warwick accommodations are perfect for any Rhode Island traveler. This Providence Warwick hotel is close to Downtown Providence, the RI Convention Center and near TF Green Warwick Providence Airport. Whether in RI for business or pleasure, guests enjoy the central location & smart choices this Courtyard provides. Courtyard Warwick Providence guests enjoy easy access to Newport, Providence, Foxboro Stadium, & Dunkin Donuts Center - home to Providence Bruins Hockey Team. Visitors looking for a hotel near Brown University, Providence College, Johnson & Wales, and the University of Rhode Island find the Courtyard Providence Warwick an ideal location. Beautiful RI beaches, Twin River Casino and the unique Providence WaterFire experience are also near the Courtyard Providence Warwick hotel. All guestrooms have NEW flatscreen TV's. Stay connected in our hotel with complimentary high-speed Internet & Business Center & stay fit with our heated indoor pool, fitness center & Jacuzzi.
